Description: Shoulder sherd of Attic black-figured pottery neck-amphora; exterior; at top of shoulder alternate red and black tongues; below, black-figure decoration consisting of hoplite riding horse to right (of the hoplite helmeted head with added white on crest, upper torso, shield and part of spear held in right hand remain; of horse, part of head with white mane, red neck, and shoulder).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 126, pl. XXXVIII, no. 353.2)
CVA Boston I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum, USA Fasc. 14, Museum of Fine Arts, Boston, Fasc. 1 (p. 43, pl. 58, no. 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 232, no. 177)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0853)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4759 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
